page.title: 09AGRICULTURE IN EAGLESFIELD
page.content: { Farming}in this area of Scotland in 1985 will long be remembered as one of ,if not the worst in living memory.As I write this at the end of October the harvest fields have just been cleared,in some case the second cut of silage is now in and the potatoe crop is being lifted.The{dairy farms}have had to put the cows inside much earlier than usual owing to the wet conditions,which not only affected the fields but also the milk yields. Most of the farms in this area are mixed rather than specialising in one branch of farming,some have dairy herds and also grow barley and potatoes, others have beef and sheep enterprises with some{arable}ground to supplement winter feeding.There are two specialist{chicken farms}which are engaged in scientific breeding programmes.
